content.question: Which of the following pieces of evidence most directly challenges Jardine’s implied claim that the Scientific Revolution was characterized by a universal change in outlook?

choices.label: Copernicus’ development of the heliocentric view of the cosmos
William Harvey’s discovery of the circulation of the blood through the body
Galileo’s observation of moons orbiting Jupiter

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
